text_blocks.text:
Aim: A shock analysis was carried out to investigate the structural performance of the BEM LDI Rev 12.1 and BMCM Rev 20.1 components to dynamic shock events.

Methodology: An explicit dynamic analysis using a 25g (Z & X axis) and 20g (Y axis) half sine shock pulse over 6.0 ms was applied to the model with the test rig fixture to replicate physical test TPJLR.14.093.
 
Results Summary:












Conclusions:
Contactor carrier busbar locators have high plastic strains due to clashing of the busbar in shock loading. In the fix-loop studies, the design revision of 41.1 is improved by increasing swept radius in the busbar locators and reducing the busbar movement with adding an extra adhesive patch. The remained peak stresses in the busbar locators are localised and considered as a low risk of failure without effecting the integrity of the part. 
     Please refer: Edd256000_EMA_UR_BEM_Internals_Shock_Analysis_Report_b211_26112024.pdf
All the other BEM and BMCM components are satisfying the pass condition for shock loading. The plastic strain values are within the targets.

Recommendations:
Ensure initial and dynamic clearances for the busbar covers to minimize the risk of interaction with the other parts. 
Review the dFMEA on the risk of clashing conditions for busbar type 11 to contactor carrier.
Monitor closely the interaction between contactor carrier and the busbar type 11 during physical test for any evidence of failure.
Please follow-up the PSD results for the fix-loop designs of contactor carrier and connector tower.
EMA LR IPB2 BEM Battery Pack Shock Analysis
Edd231804\b246 EPESS-50028 | Analyst: C. Gowda (cgowda) | Lead Analyst: O. Akyol (oakyol) | CL: S. Sever (ssever) | 13/12/2024

Edd231804\b246 EPESS-50028 | Analyst: C. Gowda (cgowda) | Lead Analyst: O. Akyol (oakyol) | CL: S. Sever (ssever) | 13/12/2024

Nominal Pulse
          Limits of tolerance
A – Peak acceleration of nominal pulse
D – Duration of nominal pulse

Analysis is carried out to replicate TPJLR.00.047 testing procedure consisting of a half sine-wave pulse
Deviations from procedure: 25g applied at rig to achieve 30g on pack. 

Peak Acceleration: 25 g (X and Z axis), 20 g (Y axis) 
Pulse Duration: 6.0 ms 
Test Duration per Axis: 20 pulses in each axis direction (40 pulses in total) 
Total Test Duration: 120 pulses (3 x 40 pulses per axis)

For analysis purposes, the shock is conducted by attachment to a rig fixture via the pack fixings. 

The test requirement states: 
On completion of the test or test program the sample shall be free from cracking, permanent deformation and/or any other form of breakage/fracture. 

For analysis, this is interpreted as any part that exceeds half of the strain at break, based on the number of cycles to be run. Plastic deformation that does not exceed this value is recorded for reference.
Mechanical Shock Durability Test Requirement
